segments.en: Hello English learners and welcome back to another great lesson with EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 你好，英语学习者，欢迎回到另一个精彩的EnglishPod课程。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
And I'm Erica.
And today we're bringing you a great intermediate lesson with some really useful vocabulary.
segments.cn: 今天我们为你带来一节很棒的中级课程，包含一些非常实用的词汇。

segments.en: Some vocabulary you can use to describe your job.
segments.cn: 一些你可以用来描述你工作的词汇。

segments.en: Yes, this is a really common situation when someone asks you what you do and you have to tell them.
segments.cn: 是的，当有人问你做什么时，这是一种非常常见的情况，你需要告诉他们。

segments.en: Exactly, so today's lesson is all about that.
segments.cn: 正是如此，所以今天的课程就是关于这个。

segments.en: So before we jump into our dialogue, let's start with our vocabulary lesson.
segments.cn: 在我们进入对话之前，让我们先开始词汇课。

segments.en: Vocabulary preview.
We have two simple phrases today that you'll hear in our dialogue for our vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 今天我们有两个简单的短语，你将在我们的对话中听到。

segments.en: The first one is VP.
VP.
VP.
So the VP of a company is the Vice President.
The Vice President, exactly.
Yeah, simple little acronym.
And the next word is Fortune 500 Company.
segments.cn: 下一个词是财富500强公司。

segments.en: Fortune 500 Company.
Fortune 500 Company.
So a Fortune 500 Company is... I'll let you explain.
segments.cn: 所以财富500强公司是……我让你来解释。

segments.en: Well, Fortune Magazine ranks the 500 biggest companies in the US.
segments.cn: 嗯，财富杂志评选出美国500家最大的公司。

segments.en: So a Fortune 500 Company basically is... One of the 500 biggest companies in the US.
segments.cn: 所以财富500强公司基本上是……美国500家最大的公司之一。

segments.en: Okay, that's simple.
Yep.
Alright, well with those words, it sounds like we're going to be talking to some important people today.
segments.cn: 好吧，听起来我们今天要和一些重要的人交谈。

segments.en: Yes, we are going to be talking to some important people.
segments.cn: 是的，我们将与一些重要的人交谈。

segments.en: So let's listen to our dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 那么让我们第一次听听我们的对话。

segments.en: Now it's going to be a little bit fast, but you don't have to worry about it.
segments.cn: 现在会有点快，但你不必担心。

segments.en: Because we'll come back and explain all of the important vocabulary.
segments.cn: 因为我们会回来解释所有重要的词汇。

segments.en: Nice to meet you.
This is my husband, Arthur.
Hey, how's it going?
Hello.
Caroline talks about you all the time.
I guess you must be pretty busy at work.
segments.cn: 我想你在工作上一定很忙。

segments.en: Well, yeah, VP position is not easy, you know.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的，VP职位可不容易，你知道的。

segments.en: I implement policies and procedures nationwide in various departments, as well as train junior managers in FDA and EPA regulations.
segments.cn: 我在全国各部门实施政策和程序，并培训初级经理关于FDA和EPA的规定。

segments.en: I also have to oversee daily operations of our quality control for the entire East Coast.
segments.cn: 我还必须监督我们整个东海岸的质量控制日常运营。

segments.en: That alone means I have 1,500 employees under me.
segments.cn: 仅此一项就意味着我有1500名员工在我手下。

segments.en: Wow.
Yeah, that sounds exciting.
And what about you, Arthur?
What do you do for a living?
Oh, I'm a Top Gun pilot.
Alright, great music for our dialogue again, huh?
segments.cn: 好吧，我们的对话又有很棒的音乐，对吧？

segments.en: Chosen by?
By moi.
Of course.
Yeah, Top Gun is one of my all-time favorite movies.
segments.cn: 是的，顶尖飞行员是我最喜欢的电影之一。

segments.en: And Top Gun pilot, what a cool profession.
segments.cn: 顶尖飞行员，真是个酷炫的职业。

segments.en: An excellent profession.
Much cooler than being, like, the VP.
segments.cn: 比起当副总裁要酷多了。

segments.en: How boring is that?
Anyway, this guy was a bit of a jerk, don't you think?
segments.cn: 不管怎样，这家伙有点无礼，你不觉得吗？

segments.en: Yeah, you can tell a little bit of the sarcastic tone he had in his voice.
segments.cn: 是的，你可以听出他声音中的讽刺语气。

segments.en: Definitely.
But he did use some interesting phrases, and we can talk about those now.
segments.cn: 但他确实使用了一些有趣的短语，我们现在可以讨论这些。

segments.en: Right, so let's take a look at language takeaway.
segments.cn: 对，所以让我们看看语言要点。

segments.en: Our first word for language takeaways is implement.
segments.cn: 我们的第一个语言要点是实施。

segments.en: Implement.
Implement.
Implement.
Let's listen to some examples of this word to help us understand its meaning.
segments.cn: 让我们听听这个词的一些例子，以帮助我们理解其含义。

segments.en: Okay, great examples.
And just in case, to implement means to... Put into action.
segments.cn: 以防万一，实施的意思是……付诸行动。

segments.en: To put into action.
Great.
Our second word for language takeaway is policies.
segments.cn: 我们的第二个语言要点是政策。

segments.en: Policies.
Policies.
Policies.
So, policies are basically rules and regulations.
segments.cn: 所以，政策基本上是规则和规定。

segments.en: Exactly.
Formal rules.
For a company or an organization.
Exactly.
Policies.
Great.
Third word?
Oversea.
Oversea.
Oversea.
Oversea.
So, when you oversee operations, it means... Like, you watch it to make sure it's okay.
segments.cn: 所以，当你监督运营时，这意味着……你观察它以确保一切正常。

segments.en: You supervise it.
This is an excellent word to use when you want to talk about your job responsibilities.
segments.cn: 这是一个很好的词，用于谈论你的工作职责。

segments.en: Oversea.
Great.
And our last word for language takeaway, it's kind of tricky, so let's listen to how it was used in our dialogue.
segments.cn: 我们最后一个语言要点，这个有点棘手，所以让我们听听它在对话中的用法。

segments.en: That alone means I have 1,500 employees under me.
segments.cn: 仅此一项就意味着我有1500名员工在我手下。

segments.en: That alone means I have 1,500 employees under me.
segments.cn: 仅此一项就意味着我有1500名员工在我手下。

segments.en: So, this guy has 1,500 employees under him, meaning he supervises 1,500 employees.
segments.cn: 所以，这家伙有1500名员工在他手下，意味着他监督1500名员工。

segments.en: Right, he manages 1,500 employees.
He must be a busy man.
Yes, for 1,500 employees.
How many employees do you have under you, Erika?
Uh, two.
Yeah, not quite as much as 1,500.
Yeah, I guess I'm not a BP right yet, hey?
segments.cn: 是的，我想我还不是副总裁，对吧？

segments.en: Not yet, but you will.
Okay.
Alright, so with this in mind, we are ready to listen to our dialogue for a second time, and this time it's going to be slower.
segments.cn: 好的，考虑到这一点，我们准备好第二次听对话，这次会慢一点。

segments.en: Oh, look!
There's Caroline and her boyfriend.
segments.cn: 那是卡罗琳和她的男朋友。

segments.en: She's always going on about him at the office.
segments.cn: 她在办公室总是提到他。

segments.en: Oh, great, they saw us.
segments.cn: 哦，太好了，他们看到了我们。

segments.en: They're coming this way.
Oh, man.
Jessica!
Arthur!
Hi!
I'd like you to meet my boyfriend, Greg.
segments.cn: 我想让你们认识我的男朋友，格雷格。

segments.en: He's the VP of Quality and Safety for a top Fortune 500 food company.
segments.cn: 他是某家顶级财富500强食品公司的质量与安全副总裁。

segments.en: Nice to meet you.
This is my husband, Arthur.
Hey, how's it going?
Caroline talks about you all the time.
I guess you must be pretty busy at work.
segments.cn: 我想你在工作上一定很忙。

segments.en: Well, yeah.
A VP position is not easy, you know.
segments.cn: 副总裁的职位可不容易，你知道的。

segments.en: I implement policies and procedures nationwide of various departments as well as trained junior managers in FDA and EPA regulations.
segments.cn: 我负责全国各部门的政策和程序实施，并培训初级经理关于FDA和EPA的规定。

segments.en: I also have to oversee daily operations of our quality control for the entire East Coast.
segments.cn: 我还必须监督整个东海岸的质量控制日常运营。

segments.en: That alone means I have 1,500 employees under me.
segments.cn: 光这一点就意味着我有1500名员工。

segments.en: Wow, yeah.
That sounds exciting.
And what about you, Arthur?
What do you do for a living?
Oh, I'm a top gun pilot.
Okay, great stuff.
With this, now we can start with our fluency builder for today.
segments.cn: 现在我们可以开始今天的流利度训练了。

segments.en: Fluency builder.
We heard some excellent phrases in this dialogue.
segments.cn: 我们在这个对话中听到了一些很好的短语。

segments.en: Some phrases that sound really natural, hey?
segments.cn: 有些短语听起来非常自然，对吧？

segments.en: Yes, especially the first one that we have today is whenever someone talks and talks and talks and continuously talks without stopping, you would say...
segments.cn: 是的，尤其是我们今天的第一个短语是，当某人不停地说话时，你可以说...

segments.en: She's always going on about him at the office.
segments.cn: 她在办公室总是提到他。

segments.en: This is a really natural way of saying keeps talking about.
segments.cn: 这是一种非常自然的表达方式，表示“继续谈论”。

segments.en: Right, keeps talking about him.
So we have a few examples of how this phrase works.
segments.cn: 所以我们有几个例子来说明这个短语的用法。

segments.en: Let's listen.
Example 1.
My boss is always going on about how we need to save money.
segments.cn: 我的老板总是提到我们需要节省开支。

segments.en: It's all he talks about.
segments.cn: 这就是他所谈论的全部。

segments.en: Example 2.
Gary is always going on about his kids.
segments.cn: 加里总是提到他的孩子。

segments.en: He's always talking about how smart they are.
segments.cn: 他总是谈论他们有多聪明。

segments.en: Example 3.
My mom is always going on about how I should get married.
segments.cn: 我妈妈总是提到我应该结婚。

segments.en: Okay, excellent.
It's clear now.
Okay, so let's move on to our second phrase for today.
segments.cn: 好的，我们继续今天的第二个短语。

segments.en: And this is a great one to use whenever you meet someone for the first time.
segments.cn: 这是一个很好的短语，可以在第一次见到某人时使用。

segments.en: Or when you start to talk to someone for the first time.
segments.cn: 或者当你第一次和某人交谈时。

segments.en: So this is a really relaxed and natural way of saying, how are you?
segments.cn: 这是一种非常轻松自然的问候方式，问“你好吗？”

segments.en: So yeah, you can just say, hey, how's it going?
segments.cn: 所以你可以直接说，嘿，最近怎么样？

segments.en: Really natural sounding.
Now our third phrase is the most important one of our dialogue.
segments.cn: 现在我们的第三个短语是我们对话中最重要的一个。

segments.en: And it's a really common situation.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常常见的情况。

segments.en: When someone asks you about your job, they might say this.
segments.cn: 当有人问你关于你的工作时，他们可能会这样说。

segments.en: So this is a really great way of asking, what work do you do?
segments.cn: 这是一个很好的方式来询问“你做什么工作？”

segments.en: Or what is your job?
Yes, I know a lot of students sometimes say, what is your job?
segments.cn: 是的，我知道很多学生有时会说“你的工作是什么？”

segments.en: Yeah, and that is kind of correct, but not really.
segments.cn: 是的，这种说法有点正确，但并不完全。

segments.en: It doesn't sound very natural.
Right.
So you want to use what do you do?
segments.cn: 所以你应该使用“你做什么？”

segments.en: Or what do you do for a living?
Sounds great.
That's the way you ask someone what is their job.
segments.cn: 这就是你问某人工作是什么的方式。

segments.en: And that's how you sound super natural.
segments.cn: 这样你听起来就非常自然。

segments.en: Okay, so we're ready now to listen to our dialogue last time.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们准备好最后一次听我们的对话了。

segments.en: And now you are ready to understand everything.
segments.cn: 现在你准备好理解一切。

segments.en: Oh, look, there's Caroline and her boyfriend.
segments.cn: 哦，看看，那是卡罗琳和她的男朋友。

segments.en: She's always going on about him at the office.
segments.cn: 她在办公室总是提到他。

segments.en: Great, they saw us.
segments.cn: 太好了，他们看到了我们。

segments.en: They're coming this way.
Oh, man.
Jessica!
Arthur!
Hi!
I'd like you to meet my boyfriend, Greg.
segments.cn: 我想让你们认识我的男朋友，格雷格。

segments.en: He's the VP of Quality and Safety for a top Fortune 500 food company.
segments.cn: 他是某家顶级财富500强食品公司的质量与安全副总裁。

segments.en: Nice to meet you.
This is my husband, Arthur.
Hey, how's it going?
Hello?
Caroline talks about you all the time.
I guess you must be pretty busy at work.
segments.cn: 我想你在工作上一定很忙。

segments.en: Well, yeah, a VP position is not easy, you know.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的，副总裁的职位可不容易，你知道的。

segments.en: I implement policies and procedures nationwide in various departments, as well as trained junior managers in FDA and EPA regulations.
segments.cn: 我负责全国各部门的政策和程序实施，并培训初级经理关于FDA和EPA的规定。

segments.en: I also have to oversee daily operations of our quality control for the entire East Coast.
segments.cn: 我还必须监督整个东海岸的质量控制日常运营。

segments.en: That alone means I have 1,500 employees under me.
segments.cn: 光这一点就意味着我有1500名员工。

segments.en: Wow, yeah, that sounds exciting.
And what about you, Arthur?
What do you do for a living?
Oh, I'm a top gun pilot!
Okay, so I have a little challenge for our listeners today.
segments.cn: 好的，我今天给我们的听众一个小挑战。

segments.en: What is it?
Two challenges, actually.
The first one, who performs the song that you heard, and what is the song called?
segments.cn: 第一个，谁演唱了你听到的那首歌，歌名是什么？

segments.en: Okay, I don't know the answer, so I'm looking forward to seeing what users do.
segments.cn: 好吧，我不知道答案，所以我期待看到用户的反应。

segments.en: And the second one is, what is the number one company in the Fortune 500?
segments.cn: 第二个是，财富500强中排名第一的公司是什么？

segments.en: Oh, I also don't know this answer.
segments.cn: 哦，我也不知道这个答案。

segments.en: Two great questions, so I expect to see your answers on the comments page, but also we want to know about your profession.
segments.cn: 两个很好的问题，所以我期待在评论页面看到你们的答案，但我们也想知道你们的职业。

segments.en: Yes, tell us about your job, tell us what you do, and use some of the great phrases you learned today to describe your answer.
segments.cn: 是的，告诉我们你的工作，告诉我们你在做什么，并使用今天学到的一些好短语来描述你的答案。

segments.en: Great!
So we hope to see you there, but we're out of time now.
segments.cn: 我们希望在那里见到你，但现在时间不够了。

segments.en: So, we'll see everyone at EnglishPod.com, leave all your questions, and of course, all the comments.
segments.cn: 所以，我们将在EnglishPod.com见到大家，留下你们所有的问题，当然，还有所有的评论。

segments.en: And Marco and I are always around to answer your questions.
segments.cn: 马尔科和我总是在这里回答你们的问题。

segments.en: Well, until then, it's goodbye!
